intro: Cheiranthus rhaeticus, commonly known as the Alpine candytuft, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with characteristic four-petaled flowers. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky and well-drained soils, often found in mountainous areas. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine arrangements.
